xml.purpose: Intended for documents published on the Web.
xml.main features:
Consists of markup (<,>,&,;) and content,
        has strict rules,
        does not contain text, except for code elements.
xml.main application: Used in data interchange, office tools etc.

html.purpose: The standard language for Web pages.
html.main features:
Not strict–txt allowed,
        severe markup errors not fatal,
        unsuitable for data storage.
html.main application:
The only language used
        for creating web-pages.

MD.purpose:
for better reading, conversion
        into HTML/XML structures.
MD.main features:
Convenient for interchange of info,
        easily readable, plain text formatting for writing in the web.
MD.main application: Can be used for inclusion into other codes.

JSON.purpose:
the lightweight format for storing
        and delivering data.
JSON.main features:
Easily readable, low character number,
        quick in rendering.
JSON.main application:
Widely used on web applications
        for data interchange.
